greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = product{p|n, p=prime} p^b(p,n), where each b(p,n) is a positive integer and the product is over distinct prime divisors of n, a(n) = difference between the maximum p^b(p,n) and minimum p^b(p,n).
comment: a(n)=0 iff n a prime or a power of a prime. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 10 2005
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: For 24 = 2^3 *3, 2^3 and 3 are separated by 5, so a(30) = 5.
mathematica: pf[n_] := Block[{pb = Flatten[ Table[ #[[1]]^#[[2]], {1}] & /@ FactorInteger[n]]}, Max[pb] - Min[pb]]; Table[ pf[n], {n, 2, 100}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 10 2005 *)
program: (PARI) A100574(n) = if(1==n,0,my(f=factor(n), v = vector(#f[, 1], i, f[i, 1]^f[i, 2])); vecmax(v)-vecmin(v)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 06 2018
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Jan 02 2005
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 10 2005
